since.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
since.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
The factory has been here since the 1970s.
It was exactly five years since her father had died.
Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
We’ve been friends ever since we were at school together.
She’s been terrified of the sound of aircraft ever since the crash.
We came to the UK in 1974 and have lived here ever since.
since.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: used to give the reason for something
since.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Since you are unable to answer, perhaps we should ask someone else.
since.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: You use since with a time, year, date, or other point in time
He has been living in England since 2008
We’ve known about it since May
since.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: Don’t use since with a period of time
He has been living in England since 12 years
since.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: You use the present perfect before since
I have liked him since we first met
We’ve been driving since six this morning
I like him since we first met
since.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3: You also use the past perfect before since
She had been waiting since five o’clock
She was waiting since five o’clock
since.translation[0].note_box[0].items[4: You use the simple past tense after since
He has grown since I last saw him
since.translation[0].note_box[0].items[5: You use for with a period of time
I’ve known him for ten years
